intro: Chelyella purpurea, commonly known as the purple chelidonium, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a flowering plant that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in temperate regions. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are deeply lobed and have a distinctive, often reddish or purplish hue. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
